intro: Heterotheca horrida subsp. cinerascens, commonly known as the cinerascens hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its gray-green foliage and showy yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar composite flower structures.
